page.title: 05HOUSING, APPLETON AND HORNBY
page.content: occupied,though some are rented.The oldest houses in Appleton are Garth house and Mr. Harris's house opposite. Both are on Front St., overlooking the village greens,both are about 400years old.Some interesting conversions have taken place Holme View in Baker St. was a Methodist Chapel, the house on the corner next to "Briarmead" was originally a Mechanics Institute, at Hornby the old mill is now a house. Most people in private housing have moved into Appleton within the last 20years because they wanted to live in pleasant countryside within travelling distance of industrial and comercial centres.People who come to live in Appleton Wiske like it,and the main reason for moving away is change of job.The 30 or so houses that make up the village of Hornby are mostly grouped around the village green. Nick
